name: Alexander the Great: A Biography
description: Conqueror of Persia, founder of cities, dead at 32 — the man who remade the ancient world and left chaos in his wake

name: Adolf Hitler: A Biography
description: From failed artist to history's greatest monster — how a democracy died and a continent burned

name: Winston Churchill: A Biography
description: Wartime savior, imperial defender, flawed genius — the man who held Britain together and the empire he refused to release

name: Mahatma Gandhi: A Biography
description: Nonviolent revolutionary who broke the British Empire — and the contradictions that complicate his sainthood

name: Nelson Mandela: A Biography
description: 27 years in prison, then the presidency — how one man's forgiveness held a nation together

name: Otto von Bismarck: A Biography
description: Blood and iron — the statesman who unified Germany, invented the welfare state, and planted the seeds of two world wars

name: Catherine the Great: A Biography
description: A German princess who seized the Russian throne, expanded an empire, and debated philosophy with Voltaire

name: Mao Zedong: A Biography
description: Revolutionary, nation-builder, mass murderer — the man who remade China at the cost of tens of millions of lives

name: Simón Bolívar: A Biography
description: The Liberator who freed six nations from Spain — then watched his dream of continental unity die

name: Mustafa Kemal Atatürk: A Biography
description: The soldier who saved Turkey from partition and dragged it into modernity — by force if necessary

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt: A Biography
description: Four terms, a Depression, a World War — the president who remade American government and redefined what leadership means in a crisis
